item.description:
Core Physical Street Defense – Progressive Boundary Setting

7:30 to 8:30 is structured for beginners

What can you expect:
• 5 minute warm up - then 50 minutes learning physical street defense basics
• Free Instruction from experienced open minded martial artists with varied backgrounds, gender, race and opinion.
• A mix of beginners, people looking to get back into something or looking to just get out and get moving.
• With some regular attendance you will be more confident in your ability to Disrupt a would be attacker.
• The choice to participate or not on any activity that we might be working on
• Permission to ask if something could work or not work for you.
• An increase of your understanding of the difference between Self Defense, Martial Arts and Competitive Sport.

What this is not
• A Sales pitch for a yearly contract
• A pitch for a specific system or style of Martial Arts
• An unrealistic message that with one class you can defend yourself from anyone
• A tough guy or girl competition

Please come out and join us.

The Arlington Martial Arts MeetUp starts at the end of this class and anyone who would like to observe or participate in that group is welcome as well.

Donations are always welcome and go towards Not Me! a non profit organization dedicated to providing instruction, conditioning and training to at risk populations.

group.name: The Arlington Martial Arts Meetup Group

item.name: Core Physical Street Defense – Progressive Boundary Setting Class
